signals: NVIDIA anuncia Rubin para 2026, consolidando la hoja de ruta de hardware para el escalado masivo de computación.
Google lanza Gemini 3 Deep Think, priorizando el razonamiento complejo para ciencia e ingeniería avanzada.
La arquitectura de chiplets se posiciona como el estándar necesario para la próxima generación de semiconductores.
Europa intensifica su apuesta por la infraestructura de inteligencia soberana con apoyo estratégico de NVIDIA.
Los modelos de mundo interactivos de Google DeepMind marcan la transición de IA generativa a simulación dinámica.
risks: Cuellos de botella técnicos en la interconexión y empaquetado avanzado de la nueva economía de chiplets.
Dependencia crítica de hardware de vanguardia para sostener el ritmo de entrenamiento de modelos de razonamiento.
Saturación del mercado de consumo ante la proliferación de planes de suscripción premium como Google AI Plus.
watch: El impacto de Gemini 3 Deep Think en la productividad de sectores de investigación científica y desarrollo.
La ejecución de la plataforma Rubin tras el ciclo de dominancia de la arquitectura Blackwell.
Resultados del Chiplet Summit sobre la estandarización de componentes modulares en silicio.

items.title: NVIDIA Rubin Platform, Open Models, Autonomous Driving: NVIDIA Presents Blueprint for the Future at CES
items.summary: NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang took the stage at the Fontainebleau Las Vegas to open CES 2026, declaring that AI is scaling into every domain and every device. “Computing has been fundamentally reshaped as a result of accelerated computing, as a result of artificial intelligence,” Huang said. “What that means is some $10 trillion Read Article
items.why: El anuncio de la plataforma Rubin define el futuro de la infraestructura de IA y la continuidad de la ley de scaling.

items.title: Gemini 3 Deep Think: Advancing science, research and engineering
items.why: Gemini 3 Deep Think enfocado en razonamiento avanzado, compitiendo directamente con modelos de razonamiento tipo O1.

items.title: NVIDIA CEO Drops the Blueprint for Europe’s AI Boom
items.summary: At GTC Paris — held alongside VivaTech, Europe’s largest tech event — NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang delivered a clear message: Europe isn’t just adopting AI — it’s building it. “We now have a new industry, an AI industry, and it’s now part of the new infrastructure, called intelligence infrastructure, that will be used Read Article
items.why: NVIDIA posiciona a Europa como un hub de infraestructura de inteligencia, clave para la autonomía tecnológica regional.

items.title: Silicon Catalyst at the Chiplet Summit: Advancing the Chiplet Economy
items.summary:
The rapid evolution of semiconductor design has elevated chiplets from a niche concept to a foundational strategy for next-generation computing. At the upcoming Chiplet Summit – February 17–19, 2026 Santa Clara Convention Center. Silicon Catalyst will play a central role in shaping this conversation, highlighting… Read More

items.why: La transición a una economía de chiplets es fundamental para superar los límites físicos de los chips monolíticos en IA.

items.title: Project Genie: Experimenting with infinite, interactive worlds
items.why: Project Genie permite la creación de mundos infinitos, un salto tecnológico en generación de video y simulación física.

items.title: Hear more about interactive world models in our latest podcast.
items.summary: Project Genie: Create and explore worlds
items.why: Project Genie representa un avance en modelos de mundo interactivos, clave para simulaciones y entornos virtuales dinámicos.

items.title: Ceva’s Strategic Play in the AI Surge: From Smart Edge to Scalable AI Platforms
items.summary:
Ceva, Inc. is known as a leading licensor of silicon and software IP for connected devices and is actively transforming its business to capture growth from the global AI boom. Rather than relying solely on traditional wireless connectivity IP, the company has strategically expanded its portfolio, partnerships, and ecosystem… Read More

items.why: Ceva pivota hacia IP de IA escalable, capturando el crecimiento de la IA en dispositivos de borde fuera del datacenter.

items.title: Google AI Plus is now available everywhere our AI plans are available, including the U.S.
items.summary: We’re launching Google AI Plus in 35 new countries and territories including the US, making it available everywhere Google AI plans are available.
items.why: Expansión global de Google AI Plus que busca consolidar ingresos recurrentes por servicios de IA generativa.

items.why: Nuevas métricas de evaluación de modelos basadas en juegos, necesarias para medir capacidades cognitivas más allá del texto.

items.title: It’s the Humidity: How International Researchers in Poland, Deep Learning and NVIDIA GPUs Could Change the Forecast
items.summary: For more than a century, meteorologists have chased storms with chalkboards, equations, and now, supercomputers. But for all the progress, they still stumble over one deceptively simple ingredient: water vapor. Humidity is the invisible fuel for thunderstorms, flash floods, and hurricanes. It’s the difference between a passing sprinkle and a summer downpour that sends you Read Article
items.why: Uso de Deep Learning y GPUs para mejorar la predicción de humedad y fenómenos climáticos extremos.

items.title: Natively Adaptive Interfaces: A new framework for AI accessibility
items.summary: A collage of four images, the first of a woman with curly hair in front of a silver laptop, the second of the same woman and a man with short black hair speaking on a stairwell, the third of a the same man with glasses, and an aerial image of NTID
items.why: Marco de trabajo para interfaces adaptativas que mejora la accesibilidad mediante IA, aunque su impacto industrial es moderado.

items.title: As AI Grows More Complex, Model Builders Rely on NVIDIA
items.summary: Unveiling what it describes as the most capable model series yet for professional knowledge work, OpenAI launched GPT-5.2 in December. The model was trained and deployed on NVIDIA infrastructure, including NVIDIA Hopper and GB200 NVL72 systems. GPT-5.3 Codex — the first OpenAI agentic coding model to help build itself — was released in February and Read Article
